qas.question: Which popular Swiss sport is a cross between baseball and golf?
Which old, traditional sport is considered to be the national sport by some Swiss?
What is thrown in the Swiss competition Steinstossen?
Which Swiss population is the only one to have practiced Steinstossen since prehistoric times?
What was the name of the 83.5 kg stone that symbolized the Unspunnenfest, first held in 1805?

context: Traditional sports include <a1_0>Swiss wrestling or "Schwingen"<a1_0/>. It is an old tradition from the rural central cantons and considered the national sport by some. <a0_0>Hornussen<a0_0/> is another indigenous Swiss sport, which is like a cross between baseball and golf. Steinstossen is the Swiss variant of stone put, a competition in throwing <a2_0>a heavy stone<a2_0/>. Practiced only among the <a3_0>alpine<a3_0/> population since prehistoric times, it is recorded to have taken place in Basel in the 13th century. It is also central to the Unspunnenfest, first held in 1805, with its symbol the 83.5 kg stone named <a4_0>Unspunnenstein<a4_0/>.
